Key Match Events: Jordan Walker had an RBI double and Lars Nootbaar homered to account for the Cardinals' two runs
Nolan Arenado had a single in four at-bats and in the series was 2-of-11 with both of the hits singles
Steven Matz worked two scoreless innings of relief
Andrew Kittredge allowed a one-out single before hitting his second double of the game to drive in the go-ahead run
Post-Match Reflections: The loss dropped the Cardinals back below.500 for the season at 74-75 with 13 games remaining
The Cardinals only scored four or more runs in three of their 13 games so far in September
Paul Goldschmidt and Masyn Winn got the day off although Goldschmidt hit into a double play as a pinch-hitter in the eighth and played first in the bottom of the inning
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cardinals were hitless in five at-bats with a runner on second
The Cardinals have been held without a hit with a runner in scoring position in five of their last nine games, going a combined 7-of-64 in those games
Others: Mile Mikolas allowed just one hit through the first four innings, but hit a batter leading off the fifth in front of a two-run homer by Davis Schneider
Mikolas was lifted after the inning despite only throwing 72 pitches
The Cardinals only scored seven runs in the three games in the series and had a combined total of two hits in 27 at-bats with a runner in scoring position
